intro: Satyria ulei, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandwort, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, often blue or purple flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, adapted to survive in dry, sandy environments. Satyria ulei is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
